executive_summary: The surge in the popularity of online shopping, along with an increase in per capita disposable income and consumer spending, contributed to significant revenue growth for the industry. Overall, industry revenue will climb at a CAGR of 16.3% over the five years to 2024 to reach an estimated $43.3 billion in 2024, including expected growth of 4.3% in 2024.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Consumers are Driving the Popularity of Mobile Grocery Shopping Due to Their Demand for Convenience
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The rise in mobile shopping continues to grow as more smartphones and internet access become available, making online grocery platforms more accessible and beneficial to consumers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Brick-and-Mortar Grocery Stores Still Pose Strong Competition
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Although online shopping saves time compared to visiting a store, it often requires consumers to be at home to store food promptly, deterring some from using online ordering.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Consumers also question the cost-effectiveness of online grocery shopping.
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: For small orders of miscellaneous items, high flat-rate delivery fees may not be justified. Many prefer to shop for perishable items like bread, fruit, and eggs in person to inspect the products themselves.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Business Models Are Evolving To Attract A Broader Consumer Base.
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Most established supermarkets entering the online space now offer home delivery from individual locations, which requires significant infrastructure but generates fee-based revenue.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Heightened Familiarity Will Boost Online Grocery Sale Penetration
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Internet traffic will continue to grow over the next five years, fueled by an increasing number of mobile connections and the deeper integration of the internet into everyday life, which will support online grocery services.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Rising Disposable Income Will Support Delivery Services
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite concerns about a potential recession, consumers are anticipated to become more confident in the US economy over the next five years. As disposable income rises, consumers are expected to spend more on grocery delivery services.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Advancements in Technology Will Support the Industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As rapid technological advancements continue, online grocery retailers will invest in the latest technology to maximize efficiency and stay competitive.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Large Players Will Continue to Dominate
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Over the next five years, large companies like Amazon and Walmart will continue dominating the online grocery market. These retailers will keep gaining market share because of their strong brand recognition and investment in the latest technology.

industry_definition: Online grocery companies sell grocery items through online channels, including those wholly based online as well as those with a physical presence that also sell food products on the internet.
key_trends: Prices have become an important factor. Consumers can easily compare prices across platforms, so to mitigate this online grocery retailers offer customers various discounts, promotions, deals and club cards in addition to offering discounts on delivery charges.
Product variety is vital for success. Consumers may use an online grocer specifically for their selected products or because it offers many brands and product offerings
COVID-19 accelerated the popularity of online grocery shopping. Even as pandemic fears have subsided, consumers have continued to turn to online shopping because of the convenience.
Online grocers will focus on increasing efficiency and customer satisfaction to remain popular, online grocers will need to ease customer hesitations by ensuring prompt delivery and quality food.
Walmart is the largest online grocery store service. The company dominates sales by leveraging its well-known brand and existing infrastructure.
Several large online grocery stores make up most of the market. New online grocery stores must find niches to compete with well-established companies like Walmart, Amazon, Kroger and Wells.

Online grocers do not receive any formal assistance from the federal or state governments. However, these grocers are indirectly assisted by industry associations like the National Grocers Association (NGA), which provides networking, educational and lobbying services to online grocers.

market_segmentation.segment_description: This market segment includes consumers under the age of 34. These consumers are often in single- or dual-income households and are among the most technologically savvy, making them ideal for consumers of online grocery retailers. Consumers in this age range are typically in the beginning phases of their careers and have lower levels of income compared with older generations.

This market segment includes consumers between the ages of 35 and 54. Consumers that are part of this demographic include single- or dual-income households that are technically savvy and time-poor. This segment has a large number of families with young children, which also includes single parents. Children limit the free time consumers have to run errands, like grocery shopping. Consumers that have limited free time value the convenience of online grocery shopping.

Consumers in this market segment are between 55 and 74 years old. Many individuals in this group are at the end of their careers or in retirement, providing them with additional free time compared with younger generations. These individuals are more accustomed to stopping at a brick-and-mortar grocery location for their food purchases and may be reluctant to purchase food online. However, the option to order online and pick up in-store has appealed heavily to these individuals that may not be willing or able to carry large loads of grocery items.

This market segment includes consumers over 75 years old. This segment is not as technologically savvy and typically relies on other individuals for their care, especially as they age, limiting their ability to take advantage of online grocery services.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Fresh and Frozen Meat, Fish and Seafood
products_and_services.product_description: Products in this segment include poultry, fish and deli items
Fruits and vegetables include fresh and frozen varieties.
Products in this segment include milk, milk alternatives such as soy, almond and rice milk, as well as cheese, yogurt and butter.
Beverages include alcoholic and nonalcoholic drinks, including soft drinks and fruit juices.
This segment includes prepared frozen dinners, burritos, pizzas and desserts.
Drugs and healthcare products include items such as soaps, toothpaste, cold medicine and other personal care products, as well as tobacco products and smoking accessories.
This product segment includes items like paper towels, toilet paper, laundry detergent, trash bags and other household items and cleaning supplies.
Other foods include bakery products, canned foods, pasta, condiments, cereals, cookies and other non-perishable packaged items.

tier_1_suppliers: Fruit & Vegetable Wholesaling in the US
Beef & Pork Wholesaling in the US
Egg & Poultry Wholesaling in the US
Frozen Food Wholesaling in the US
Soft Drink, Baked Goods & Other Grocery Wholesaling in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Cookie, Cracker & Pasta Production in the US
Meat, Beef & Poultry Processing in the US
Dairy Product Production in the US
Snack Food Production in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The number of mobile internet connections represents the number of consumers that have an active internet connection on devices like smartphones and tablet computers. As the number of mobile internet connections climbs, Americans' accessibility to online shopping expands.

business_locations.location_description: The West is the largest region by industry establishment. Demand from this region is supported by a large population and higher-than-average incomes. The West is attractive for its population density and its relatively close proximity to international suppliers. This region is also home to a large number of highly populated and technically driven cities, many of which are located in California.

The Southeast region has the largest national population concentration, which is the primary driver behind business saturation. The region is home to many urban areas where consumers can easily take advantage of the online grocery business. As these cities become more popular, online grocers are more inclined to relocate to this region. This region has a high number of establishments that allow consumers to purchase groceries online and pick up at the store without leaving their car. These pick-up options have provided added convenience to consumers while reducing shipping costs for online grocery stores.

The Mid-Atlantic is the third-largest region by industry establishment. The Mid-Atlantic region is home to highly populated cities such as New York City, Philadelphia and Washington, DC, which contain target demographics for industry operators. The Mid-Atlantic has ease of access to international trade ports, allowing retailers to source foreign-made goods and cut down on purchasing costs.

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE US FOOD AND DRUG ADMINISTRATION (FDA)
regulations_points.regulation_description: Food item safety is regulated through the Administration's Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act (FFDCA), which requires that all consumable products are free of harmful ingredients. Additionally, all consumable products must be made in a clean environment and labeled clearly. The FDA hosts numerous workshops, meetings and webinars regarding food safety and regulations.

When making purchases over the internet, consumers are required to provide a credit card number and password. To help online grocers comply with online security laws and avoid potential misconduct and fines, the Board has established an Online Privacy Program, which helps its members adhere to complex privacy rules for internet apps.

regulations_points.regulation_title: The Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement
regulations_points.regulation_description: The Agreement impacts e-commerce, through which sales taxes are now required to be collected from all online retailers. This new law was implemented in 2018 based on the US Supreme Court's decision in South Dakota v. Wayfair Inc. that stated individual states can require online retailers to collect sales tax for their state on online purchases. Still, some states have tax exemptions on certain items like food or clothing.

basis_points.basis_title: Prices have become an important factor
basis_points.basis_description: Consumers can easily compare prices across platforms, so to mitigate this online grocery retailers offer customers various discounts, promotions, deals and club cards in addition to offering discounts on delivery charges.

basis_points.basis_title: Product variety is vital for success
basis_points.basis_description: Consumers may use an online grocer specifically for their selected products or because it offers many brands and product offerings.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Online shopping platforms allow consumers to compare prices at the click of a button. Less established online grocers may be pushed out of the market if they cannot offer appropriate pricing.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Larger Companies Have A Competitive Advantage
concentration_points.concentration_description: Large online grocery stores dominate the industry. These major players have significant resources that allow them to invest in the latest technology to streamline their operations.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchases are the Largest Cost for Online Grocers
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases encompass the entire inventory being sold by the online grocery store. These include the food items, essential packing materials and office equipment required for smooth operations. With the rising agricultural price index, which reflects the nominal prices received by farmers for all US agricultural products, the cost of food has strengthened.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Heightened Consumer Interest in the Convenience of Online Food Shopping Supports Profit
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The convenience of online food shopping has become increasingly attractive to consumers, driving profit for online grocers. A wider selection of online products encourages shoppers to make more e-purchases, thereby exposing them to higher-profit items.
The competition among online grocers has led to intensified marketing efforts as thousands of companies vie for customers' attention.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Employees are necessary for order processing, inventory tracking and product delivery.

volatility_points.volatility_description: The coronavirus significantly altered consumer shopping preferences which has contributed to the increase in revenue volatility over the past five years.
Fluctuations in food prices and delivery costs have increased revenue volatility in the industry over the past five years.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Online Grocers Look to Boost Revenue From Smartphone Applications
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The development and maintenance of websites and smartphone apps don't require new technology since their maintenance can be performed through existing computer programs.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Drone Delivery for Groceries is Becoming a Reality
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Major players in the industry have begun utilizing drones to deliver groceries to consumers.

FAQs.question: The Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement
FAQs.answer: The Agreement impacts e-commerce, through which sales taxes are now required to be collected from all online retailers.

FAQs.question: Industry Assistance
FAQs.answer: The National Grocers Association (NGA) provides grocers with networking, educational and lobbying services through conferences, events and research.

FAQs.question: How does your company keep track of stock levels to ensure that goods are readily available?
FAQs.answer: The business model for online grocery sales heavily dictates how companies monitor their inventory.

FAQs.question: Are your customers heavily price-conscious?
FAQs.answer: As consumers can compare processes of the same and similar products across different websites, they are expansively price-conscious.

FAQs.question: Have variable input costs negatively impacted your company's sales?
FAQs.answer: The price of food items is constantly fluctuating based on season, production and other factors.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored acquisition opportunities in order to expand reach and minimize overhead expenses?
FAQs.answer: Online retailers that can acquire or work closely with physical retailers have seen immense success.

FAQs.question: How has your company reacted to the expansion of online sales through the end of 2023?
FAQs.answer: Many companies have jumped into the industry through the end of 2023 in response to the expansion in online sales.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs through automation through the end of 2023?
FAQs.answer: Some companies have been able to reduce labor costs by establishing more streamline delivery services and offing in-store pick-up.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all health and safety requirements are met?
FAQs.answer: Companies have worked to streamline delivery times and shipment containers to ensure that they comply with FDA standards and provide quality products.

FAQs.question: Have any regulatory expenses significantly impacted profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: While there has been no new regulation, online grocers must be aware of any future changes.

FAQs.question: How does your company's profit compare with your main competitors'?
FAQs.answer: The entrance of new large companies heavily shift the industry's profit.

FAQs.question: How often does your company purchase new equipment?
FAQs.answer: Due to rapidly improving technology, online grocers must replace software often as new software becomes available.

FAQs.question: What do you do to promote loyalty and keep your customers returning for follow-up visits? Special discounts or a high-caliber client experience?
FAQs.answer: It is important to have a loyal customer base to attract repeat buyers and ensure continued sales.

FAQs.question: What factors impact demand and stock levels? What products frequently sell out and what products are in the least demand?
FAQs.answer: Online grocery stores need to be able to control stock on hand to ensure that they have adequate stock of popular items.

FAQs.question: What advantages do you offer to customers? Do you offer a friendly customer experience?
FAQs.answer: Having an easy-to-navigate website helps companies attract more consumers and drive more purchases.

FAQs.question: Do you find revenue trends to be in line with changes in competition? What products do customers tend to buy when competition is high?
FAQs.answer: Consumers may often opt to visit a physical grocery store in order to purchase an item they require.

FAQs.question: Do you expect major changes in demand from expanding disposable income levels? Do you monitor changes in disposable income?
FAQs.answer: As per capita disposable income inches up, Americans are more willing and able to shop online for their groceries.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor trends in broadband connections? Do your products implement technology that appeals to internet users?
FAQs.answer: As the number of mobile internet connections shoots up, Americans' accessibility to online shopping expands.
